wikipedia_page.main: Mark Lazarowicz ( lə-ZUURR-ə-vitch; born Marek Lazarowicz; 8 August 1953) is a British Labour Co-operative politician and lawyer who was the Member of Parliament (MP) for Edinburgh North and Leith from 2001 to 2015.

Whitehead's Private Members Bill, was 'talked out' by Conservative backbenchers in 2005, but many of the Bill's most important aspects were incorporated into the Climate Change and Sustainable Energy Act 2006, sponsored by Mark Lazarowicz MP.

*Former members include Mark Lazarowicz, MP; Catherine Stihler, MEP (alumna and 52nd Rector at the University of St Andrews); and Mark Ballard, former MSP and Rector (at the University of Edinburgh) where the People & Planet group was instrumental in his election in 2006, against a field including Magnus Linklater, Boris Johnson and John Pilger.

The 2011 Scottish Social Attitudes Survey core finding was that while 32% of respondents supported Scottish independence, 43% supported greater autonomy within the UK. 29% of respondents supported devo-max, but only 21% supported the status quo.The election of a majority Scottish National Party government in May 2011, committed to holding an independence referendum, also brought the possibility that FFA could be an extra option in the vote.Scotland independence vote could contain 'financial autonomy' option www.guardian.co.uk, 8 May 2011 Some senior Scottish Labour Party figures have also suggested that they would support devo max, including Malcolm Chisholm MSP,Malcolm Chisholm: Labour must support Devo-Max and abandon Calman  newsnetscotland.com, accessed 23 October 2011 Mark Lazarowicz MP,Salmond gives backing to ‘devo max’ ballot choice www.scotsman.com, 23 October 2011 and former First Minister Henry McLeish.

| style="text-align:center;"|Mark Lazarowicz

In 2005 he stood for the Westminster constituency of Edinburgh North and Leith, coming second to Labour's Mark Lazarowicz and securing a swing of 8.3 per cent from Labour to Lib Dem. In November 2005 he again sought election to the city council, standing in another by-election in Murrayfield, and again came second. In the 2007 Scottish Parliament elections in the smaller Scottish constituency of Edinburgh North and Leith, and again secured a large swing from Labour but still finished in second place.
